18#include "QRMaskUtil.h"
19
20#include <algorithm>
21#include <array>
22#include <cstdlib>
23#include <cassert>
24
25namespace ZXing {
26namespace QRCode {
27namespace MaskUtil {
28
29// Penalty weights from section 6.8.2.1
30static const int N1 = 3;
31static const int N2 = 3;
32static const int N3 = 40;
33static const int N4 = 10;
34
35/**
36* Helper function for applyMaskPenaltyRule1. We need this for doing this calculation in both
37* vertical and horizontal orders respectively.
38*/
39static int ApplyMaskPenaltyRule1Internal(const TritMatrix& matrix, bool isHorizontal) {
40 int penalty = 0;
41 int width = matrix.width();
42 int height = matrix.height();
43 int iLimit = isHorizontal ? height : width;
44 int jLimit = isHorizontal ? width : height;
45 for (int i = 0; i < iLimit; i++) {
46 int numSameBitCells = 0;
47 int prevBit = -1;
48 for (int j = 0; j < jLimit; j++) {
49 int bit = isHorizontal ? matrix.get(j, i) : matrix.get(i, j);
50 if (bit == prevBit) {
51 numSameBitCells++;
52 }
53 else {
54 if (numSameBitCells >= 5) {
55 penalty += N1 + (numSameBitCells - 5);
56 }
57 numSameBitCells = 1; // Include the cell itself.
58 prevBit = bit;
59 }
60 }
61 if (numSameBitCells >= 5) {
62 penalty += N1 + (numSameBitCells - 5);
63 }
64 }
65 return penalty;
66}
67
68
69/**
70* Apply mask penalty rule 1 and return the penalty. Find repetitive cells with the same color and
71* give penalty to them. Example: 00000 or 11111.
72*/
73static int ApplyMaskPenaltyRule1(const TritMatrix& matrix)
74{
75 return ApplyMaskPenaltyRule1Internal(matrix, true) + ApplyMaskPenaltyRule1Internal(matrix, false);
76}
77
78/**
79* Apply mask penalty rule 2 and return the penalty. Find 2x2 blocks with the same color and give
80* penalty to them. This is actually equivalent to the spec's rule, which is to find MxN blocks and give a
81* penalty proportional to (M-1)x(N-1), because this is the number of 2x2 blocks inside such a block.
82*/
83static int ApplyMaskPenaltyRule2(const TritMatrix& matrix)
84{
85 int penalty = 0;
86 for (int y = 0; y < matrix.height() - 1; y++) {
87 for (int x = 0; x < matrix.width() - 1; x++) {
88 auto value = matrix.get(x, y);
89 if (value == matrix.get(x+1, y) && value == matrix.get(x, y+1) && value == matrix.get(x+1, y+1)) {
90 penalty++;
91 }
92 }
93 }
94 return N2 * penalty;
95}
96
97template<size_t N>
98static bool HasPatternAt(const std::array<bool, N>& pattern, const Trit* begin, int count, int stride) {
99 assert(std::abs(count) <= (int)N);
100 auto end = begin + count * stride;
101 if (count < 0)
102 std::swap(begin, end);
103 auto a = begin;
104 for (auto b = pattern.begin(); a < end && b != pattern.end(); a += stride, ++b)
105 if (*a != *b)
106 return false;
107 return true;
108}
109
110/**
111* Apply mask penalty rule 3 and return the penalty. Find consecutive runs of 1:1:3:1:1:4
112* starting with black, or 4:1:1:3:1:1 starting with white, and give penalty to them. If we
113* find patterns like 000010111010000, we give penalty once.
114*/
115static int ApplyMaskPenaltyRule3(const TritMatrix& matrix)
116{
117 const std::array<bool, 4> white = {0, 0, 0, 0};
118 const std::array<bool, 7> finder = {1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1};
119 const int whiteSize = (int)white.size();
120 const int finderSize = (int)finder.size();
121
122 int numPenalties = 0;
123 int width = matrix.width();
124 int height = matrix.height();
125 for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
126 for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) {
127 auto i = &matrix.get(x, y);
128 if (x <= width - finderSize && HasPatternAt(finder, i, finderSize, 1) &&
129 (HasPatternAt(white, i, -std::min(x, whiteSize), 1) ||
130 HasPatternAt(white, i + finderSize, std::min(width - x - finderSize, whiteSize), 1))) {
131 numPenalties++;
132 }
133 if (y <= height - finderSize && HasPatternAt(finder, i, finderSize, width) &&
134 (HasPatternAt(white, i, -std::min(y, whiteSize), width) ||
135 HasPatternAt(white, i + finderSize * width, std::min(height - y - finderSize, whiteSize), width))) {
136 numPenalties++;
137 }
138 }
139 }
140 return numPenalties * N3;
141}
142
143/**
144* Apply mask penalty rule 4 and return the penalty. Calculate the ratio of dark cells and give
145* penalty if the ratio is far from 50%. It gives 10 penalty for 5% distance.
146*/
147static int ApplyMaskPenaltyRule4(const TritMatrix& matrix)
148{
149 auto numDarkCells = std::count_if(matrix.begin(), matrix.end(), [](int8_t cell){ return cell == 1; });
150 auto numTotalCells = matrix.size();
151 auto fivePercentVariances = std::abs(numDarkCells * 2 - numTotalCells) * 10 / numTotalCells;
152 return static_cast<int>(fivePercentVariances * N4);
153}
154
155// The mask penalty calculation is complicated. See Table 21 of JISX0510:2004 (p.45) for details.
156// Basically it applies four rules and summate all penalties.
157int CalculateMaskPenalty(const TritMatrix& matrix)
158{
159 return MaskUtil::ApplyMaskPenaltyRule1(matrix)
160 + MaskUtil::ApplyMaskPenaltyRule2(matrix)
161 + MaskUtil::ApplyMaskPenaltyRule3(matrix)
162 + MaskUtil::ApplyMaskPenaltyRule4(matrix);
163}
164
165} // MaskUtil
166} // QRCode
167} // ZXing
